thread.title: Bluesfest 2016 lineup: Kendrick Lamar to headline opening night
thread.title_full: Bluesfest 2016 lineup: Kendrick Lamar to headline opening night

author: Jenna Clarke
title: Bluesfest 2016 lineup: Kendrick Lamar to headline opening night
text:
Kendrick Lamar is coming to Australia to headline opening night of Bluesfest. Photo: Supplied 
Tom Jones and Noel Gallagher join lineup Grammy Award winning rapper Kendrick Lamar will headline opening night of Bluesfest next year.
Lamar, the No. 1 rapper and hip hop artist in the world right now, will join legendary crooner Tom Jones, The National and Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds in Byron Bay from March 24. 
The Compton born artist has won critical and commercial acclaim over the years including two Grammys in 2015 for Best Rap Song and Best Rep Performance for his track I .
Advertisement Revered amongst his peers like Pharrell Williams, who compares the 28-year-old to Bob Dylan, Imagine Dragons and Taylor Swift, he's one of the most sought after collaborators in music right now.
He recently won Video of the Year at the  MTV Video Music Award's  with Swift for his cameo, alongside Lena Dunham, Cindy Crawford and Selena Gomez, in the film clip for her track Bad Blood . He also recorded a remix of the song which hit the No. 1 stop of the Billboard Pop charts just five weeks after it was released. The corresponding video also chalked up more than half a billion views on YouTube.
Lamar's third album To Pimp a Butterfly was accidently leaked eight days ahead of schedule back in March and went on to debut at No. 1 on the Billboard 200 Chart, No.1 on the Billboard R&B and Hip Hop albums chart and No.1 on the ARIAs chart.
He has a legion of fans around the world, including Wallabies star Quade Cooper who came under fire earlier this month for posting a video containing the explicit lyrics of Lamar's hit  King Kunta on his private Facebook page.
"Some fun at villa park...  ‪#‎RWC2015 ," Cooper posted along with a 14-second highlights video of Lamar's music and some of his plays in Australia's 65-3 thrashing of Uruguay.
The controversy was caused by the lyrics:
"I got a bone to pick. 

"I don't want you monkey-mouth motherf
